title: Select issue tracker during installation
story: As a developer running isdlc init, I want to select my preferred issue tracker (GitHub Issues, Jira, or Manual) so that the framework is pre-configured for my workflow.
acceptance_criteria: A select prompt appears during installation with three options
GitHub Issues is pre-selected when a GitHub remote is detected
Manual is pre-selected when no GitHub remote is detected
The selection is stored persistently for later use

title: Validate GitHub CLI availability
story: As a developer who selected GitHub Issues, I want the installer to check if the gh CLI is available so that I know whether issue fetching will work.
acceptance_criteria: Installer checks for gh CLI when GitHub Issues is selected
Success message shown when gh is found
Warning message shown when gh is missing, with install link
Installation is not blocked by missing gh CLI

title: Guided Jira MCP server setup
story: As a developer who selected Jira, I want the installer to check if the Atlassian MCP server is configured and guide me through setup if needed so that Jira integration works from day one.
acceptance_criteria: Installer checks for Atlassian MCP server in Claude Code
If found, confirms and proceeds
If not found, displays setup command with instructions
Prompts for confirmation after user has configured MCP
Asks for default Jira project key
Falls back to manual mode gracefully if user declines setup

title: Persist tracker preference in CLAUDE.md
story: As a developer, I want my issue tracker preference stored in CLAUDE.md so that all iSDLC commands can read it without additional configuration.
acceptance_criteria: CLAUDE.md template includes an Issue Tracker Configuration section
Section contains issue_tracker type, jira_project_key, and github_repo fields
Installer interpolates selected values into the template
Existing CLAUDE.md files are not overwritten

title: Smart routing for bare number inputs
story: As a developer who has configured Jira, I want to type just '1234' in the add command and have it automatically resolve to 'PROJ-1234' so that I do not need to type the full ticket ID every time.
acceptance_criteria: Bare numbers are resolved using the configured issue_tracker preference
Jira preference prepends the configured project key
GitHub preference prepends # to form a GitHub issue reference
Manual preference treats bare numbers as manual input
Existing explicit patterns (#N, PROJECT-N) still work regardless of preference

title: Preserve tracker config during updates
story: As a developer updating iSDLC, I want my issue tracker configuration preserved so that I do not need to reconfigure after every update.
acceptance_criteria: The updater does not overwrite the Issue Tracker Configuration section
A warning is shown if the section is missing after an update

title: Dry run shows tracker selection
story: As a developer using --dry-run, I want to see what issue tracker would be configured without actually writing files.
acceptance_criteria: Dry run shows the tracker prompt
Dry run summary includes the selected tracker mode
No files are written during dry run
